title: Issis II screenshots?
content:
Does anyone have any good quality Issis pics?

I have one, but I was just wondering if anyone else had some pics.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Issis II screenshots?
content:
Nope, I don't have them saved anywhere. Nor do I know where I could see them. Yeah, too bad the project was discontinued before it was finished.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Issis II screenshots?
content:
I tried to use ScreenThief... it crashed Isis II.

Then, I tried to run Isis II into DOSBox (0.65) and take screenshots with DOSBox. Even with a DPMI server running, Isis II crashes during initialization. Sometimes it causes DOSBox to crash too.

I also tried to use DOSEmu (Linux), but I had the same problem I had with DOSBox, except that DOSEmu doesn't crash.

I really liked that fangame. In fact, whenever I feel depressed and stop writing code for my game engine, I run the last Isis II demo and play it. After playing one Isis II level, I think: "I MUST write a game engine to complete my dream of having a full-featured Keen fangame with nice music and graphics."

Without Isis II, I wouldn't have started my own game engine. I wish someone could finish making Isis II someday.[hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re: Issis II screenshots?
content:
I took some shots with help of MS Virtual PC 2004 and an old Windows 98 CD I have. Unfortunately they aren't "good quality". Perhaps VPC is not correctly scaling the actual screen resolution used by Allegro/Isis II. I crashed my host machine while trying, but anyway I have 2 screenshots of demo1 and 3 of demo 2.[hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re: Issis II screenshots?
content: Wouldn't it be a better idea just to run it on your normal OS and use an actual screenshot program? :P
